posts.title: How I Learned System Design
posts.description:
System Design is intimidating at first.
People throw words like “Sharding”, “CQRS”, “load balancer”, “eventual consistency”…
At first, it made me feel dumb. But then I realized
Everyone feels lost in the beginning.
System design isn’t a single topic. It’s not a “chapter” you can complete in a week.

posts.title: Mastering Query Optimization in MS SQL Server
posts.description: Learn how SQL Server uses clustered and non-clustered indexes to optimize queries. This blog provides practical examples with real-world tables, demonstrating index seeks, scans, and execution plans to help you understand and improve database performance.

posts.title: Keyset Pagination (Seek Method) in SQL: Efficient Paging for Large Datasets
posts.description: Learn how Keyset (Seek) Pagination improves query performance for large datasets. This blog explains how it works, compares it with traditional OFFSET pagination, and shows practical real-world use cases like infinite scroll, dashboards, and APIs.
